meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sneaky or deceitful.
meanings.sent1: Her snakinesses was evident in the way she always seemed to know everyone's secrets.
meanings.sent2: I could sense the snakinesses in his smile, making me wary of his true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's snakinesses was revealed when it tried to steal the fish from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The politician's snakinesses was like a hidden dagger, ready to strike at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The snakinesses of the fox was so cunning that it outsmarted all the other animals in the forest.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a sly or underhanded manner.
meanings.sent1: His snakinesses was exposed when he was caught cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: The snakinesses of her actions left a trail of mistrust among her friends.
meanings.sent3: The children's snakinesses was evident when they tried to sneak extra cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent4: The snakinesses of the spy was like a shadow, always lurking in the background.
meanings.sent5: The snakinesses of the thief was so smooth that no one suspected a thing until it was too late.
